articles.author: Jake Niall
articles.title: Footy's greatest COVID challenge: the grassroots game - The Age
articles.description: The greatest, or gravest, challenge confronting the game of Australian football in this pandemic isn't the loss of coaches and staff, the pay cuts, the reduction in television dollars and sponsors, or the debt clubs will ratchet up.
articles.content:
It is getting junior footy back, removing devices from house-bound COVID-zombies and persuading boys and girls to join their mates at the nearby oval for a game.
Gillon McLachlan and his commission … [+6302 chars]
